alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 4:59AM PDT until November 06 at 3:35AM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Puyallup River Near Orting affecting Pierce County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Heavy rain ended over the area late Friday. No hydrologically significant rain is forecast for the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River At Potlatch. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause moderate flooding, with deep and quick flood waters inundating some residential areas, many roads, and much of the farm land in the Skokomish Valley. Inundated roads include the Skokomish Valley road, Bourgault Road West, Purdy Cutoff Road, and Highway 106. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The river is cresting near 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to begin to recede this morning and fall below flood stage tonight. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
